lead_paragraph: President Obama's speeches suggest he doesn't dislike all banks, just the big ones, Breakingviews says. Even though he used much of his State of the Union address last week to bash Wall Street and the money business, he threw a bone to the community banking sector, the publication says.
snippet: President Obama's plan to divert $30 billion of money repaid from the Troubled Asset Relief Program to smaller banks may sounds logical, but there are problems that would make it both unworkable and bad for taxpayers, Breakingviews says.

headline.main: Do Smaller Banks Really Need $30 Billion From U.S.?

abstract: President Obama's plan to divert $30 billion of money repaid from the Troubled Asset Relief Program to smaller banks may sounds logical, but there are problems that would make it both unworkable and bad for taxpayers, Breakingviews says.
